subject: simsonn plus x pedals wobble
description_text:
Hello,

I bought the simsonn plus x pedals and there is a lot of wobbles on the brake pedal only. I tried tightening all the screws but its still there. Would you know how to fix that

conversations.body_text:
Also, the bearing at the base of the brake pedal can turn freely which means something is wrong

Get Outlook for iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>
________________________________

Hi Yani Amellal,  Please provide a video to show the wobble of the pedal, we will fix it for you, please don't worry. Also, loose bearings at the bottom of the pedal are normal and will not cause the pedal to come loose.

Here is a video of the wobble. If you need another one or other information let me know. Thank you.
________________________________

Hi Yani Amellal,     The bearing on your pedal is functioning normally. It was intentionally designed as a spacing control bearing to prevent the pedal arm from shifting toward the center under high pressure. This design will not cause any looseness.  The video you provided appears to be incomplete or failed to upload correctly — we're currently unable to view it. Please try re-uploading the full video or sharing a link via a platform like Google Drive or Dropbox so we can assist you further.

Hi Yani Amellal,  I’ve seen your video, and we can send you a new cylinder and spacer to eliminate the gap. Would that be acceptable to you? In addition, please apply more preload to the brake damper lock nut, which can also reduce damper play.
